com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction

Class BsTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.bs.dto.AbstractDto<ITransaction>
      • com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.AbstractBsTransaction
        • com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.BsTransaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.poesys.bs.dto.IDto<ITransaction>, java.lang.Comparable<com.poesys.bs.dto.IDto<ITransaction>>

    public class BsTransaction
extends AbstractBsTransaction

    A business layer data-transfer object for the Transaction. This class is the concrete subclass of the generated abstract class. Make any changes to DTO behavior by overriding methods here rather than changing the abstract superclass; AndroMDA will overwrite that class when you run it but will never overwrite this concrete subclass.

    An exchange of value between accounts; the items that correspond to the fiscal year accounts must balance (cancel each other out with respect to debits and credits)

    Stereotypes:

    • Persistent
    • SequenceKey
    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge

      java.lang.Boolean isValid()
      Is the transaction valid? To be valid, a transaction must have balanced transaction items (debits and credits sum to zero) or must be a balance transaction with a single item.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BsTransaction

        public BsTransaction(ITransaction dto)
              throws com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException
        Create a BsTransaction object from a Transaction object.
        Parameters:
        dto - the data-access layer Transaction DTO
        Throws:
        com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException - when there is a problem creating the Transaction

      • BsTransaction

        public BsTransaction(com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey key,
                     java.math.BigInteger transactionId,
                     java.lang.String description,
                     java.sql.Timestamp transactionDate,
                     java.lang.Boolean checked,
                     java.lang.Boolean balance)

        Create a BsTransaction. This constructor calls the abstract superclass constructor.

        Parameters:
        key - the primary key of the Transaction
        transactionId - primary key attribute
        description - a text describing the nature of the transaction
        transactionDate - the calendar day on which the transaction occurred
        checked - whether the transaction is reconciled and validated
        balance - whether the transaction represents a balance transaction, the transfer of an amount onto the balance sheet; balance transactions do not need to have off-setting debits and credits and are ignored in balance checking for normal transactions

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public java.lang.Boolean isValid()
        Is the transaction valid? To be valid, a transaction must have balanced transaction items (debits and credits sum to zero) or must be a balance transaction with a single item.
        Returns:
        true if valid, false if invalid
